data.title: I love Thi's Place
data.text: I love this place! The food is always great but it only seems to be open during lunch. Either way, the few times I get to eat there it's totally worth it!

data.title: Fresh, delicious Vietnamese restaurant
data.text: If your looking for an alternative to the usual Thai food, I recommend Thi's. Nice variety in the menu, food is always fresh. Service is good, albeit sometimes a little slow so if you are in a hurry may want to try it when you have more time

data.title: Tasty Thai food
data.text: We had great food, and the servers were really helpful in assisting us with trying new dishes.  I'll go back here again!

data.title: the place need more attention
data.text: this place rude pho soup not so good it ws no side salad it suppose to come with mint hot pepper and bean spout it ws none grrrr.

data.title: The Real Deal !
data.text: We ate here twice within a week - once for dinner and then back for lunch.  We tried this restaurant based on a recommendation from a local chef, because we were looking for a non-chain Thai place.  Well, Thi's is Vietnamese, not Thai, but VERY good, fresh food.  Both times my husband and I ordered each ordered something different, and we were very pleased with all four dishes.  The fried rice was light and not at all greasy and the curry was delicious with lots of fresh vegetables.  Since we like our food spicy, upon request we were brought a trio of hot spices.  I did observe that the menu is ambiguous - like "shrimp curry" and what is served may not be consistent on a daily basis, but rather based on what fresh food is available - just an observation and not a negative!

data.title: Thi's is amazing
data.text: I loved the jasmine rice...everything I've had there has been excellent...service is always outstanding as well

data.title: We love Thi
data.text: Thi, her restaurant, and her food are wonderful!  Sometimes we order a traditional Vietnamese menu item, sometimes she makes us a "surprise" dish based on what we are in the mood for (rice vs noodles, meat vs veggies, etc.).  My husband and I dine at Thi's for date night, family night, or with friends/co-workers.  We have never been disappointed with her food or service!

data.title: Food good - cleanliness iffy
data.text: Although I really loved the food, when I visited the restrooms, the floor was dirty and sticky.  It made me wonder what the kitchen was like.

data.title: Terrible experience
data.text: My Co-workers and I decided to come here because we remembered it being good several years ago; Some wanted the curry tofu and I wanted the sesame chicken. As we walked in we noticed a table of four was already there but curiously several other tables were full of dishes, glasses and linens just piled up like there wasn't anywhere to put them. Anyway, we all ordered our drinks, 2 waters and 2 cokes. The very thin waiter with glasses brought it out in a timely manner but when the two of us took a sip of our cokes we realized they were " diet", so I pulled him aside and told him and his response was " oh, I know.. It was all we have"!!!! WTH??! Anyway, we sent them back and he brought us " regular Pepsi" which was more like water because it was so flat! Anyway, I was just wanting my delicious sesame chicken by now... Well what he brought out was nothing more than some stir fry chicken, NO breaded crispy sesame chicken, not even a sesame seed!! I said " where's my sesame chicken"? He said, " that's how we prepare it here"! Ok, I've eaten it here before sir, it's never looked like this! Anyway, my friends food was also not right, very bland, NO hint of curry either.We complained until he finally got on the phone with the owner and we left without paying! I felt like WE should have been paid for the biggest waste of time I've ever had at lunch! This place has really went down and I'll NEVER go back! Also, there was a baby in the kitchen!! I'm sure DHEC would love to hear about that!

data.title: Uninvited guest
data.text: Was there in October 2012 later in the evening.  Restaurant half full with patrons.  Sat next to wall.  Wall deep yellow.  After meals served a cockroach was crawling on wall above or heads.  My girlfriend freaked out.  No staff in dining area.  She ran to kitchen door.  Banged on it.  Hostess/waitress/dishwasher lady came out.   We moved to center.  Could not stand it.  So, we left....  staff did not offer any consolation...

data.title: YUM!
data.text: The best food I've ever had in Rock Hill! Even my very picky young daughter loved it. We'll go back.

data.title: Nice change of pace in Rock Hill
data.text: Thi's Place on Main St. is a great family owned and operated restaurant with some really good Vietnamese cuisine. The Bun (choice of meats served over vermicelli with veggies) did not disappoint, and they are more than happy to tweak the ingredients to your liking. The  nước mắm was very good without being overpowering. Also enjoyed the summer roll appetizer. Very reasonably priced entrees and they serve Vietnamese beers. Ambiance could stand some improvement, but clean and comfortable.

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text:
Like most restaurants that are run on a shoestring, your experience will depend on who is cooking and who is serving.  We've had good meals and good service from here, and we've also had bad meals and bad service.  

The last time I came for lunch I was the only customer there.  The owner was engaged in conversation with two friends and finally came over to serve me.  I asked for water, but she said there was some problem with their water, so I had to order some other type of drink instead (which she charged me for).  I guess I had the alternate option of choking down my meal without a drink if I didn't want to pay for one.

The owner apparently also had to go back and cook my meal, which was indifferently prepared and presented.  Really, not much taste at all.  I guess if you dine here by yourself, they don't feel like it's worth putting much effort into it.  And it's not like I haven't been here before, and my wife and I have always been very gracious to them.

I finally decided to give up on this place, since I can't tell whether my meal or service will be good or bad.  That this place is ranked 5th in popularity tells you something about the poor quality of Rock Hill restaurants in general.

data.title: What a great experience!
data.text: I met Thi at a charity event she catered for the school district, and I enjoyed the food so much I took my family out to her restaurant the following week.  She showed us what to order, got my 2-year old and 4-year to eat (which is no easy feat!), and told us about her family.  What a great dining experience!  We are lucky to have her in Rock Hill.

data.title: Spring rolls from heaven...
data.text:
I'm not giving it an 'excellent' review because the only thing I've had there was the spring rolls so I can't comment on the rest of the menu. So, technically that's my fault.

I first ran across Thi at a home expo that was thrown locally, I was snapping photos among other things. Her house was constantly busy with finger foods ranging from softshell crab to her spring rolls. After trying the rolls I knew I'd have to take the wife by there in order to prove they were as good as I said.

You can tell the ingredients are fresh, the dipping sauce is odd because it's got quite a sweet vinegar smell which I'm not used to, but it's amazing when combined with the spring rolls.

I've yet to eat a full meal there, but I can't imagine it's anything less than great.
